column1: #Text=Polycrystalline TbInO3 is synthesized via a conventional solid-state reaction method in air.
#Text=Powders of Tb4O7 and In2O3 with an appropriate molar ratio are mixed, ground, and then pelletized for high-temperature sintering.
#Text=The pellets are sintered at 1280 °C for 36 h with intermediate grindings.
#Text=Single-crystalline TbInO3 is grown using a laserfloating- zone (LD-FZ-5-200-VPO-PC, Crystal Systems Incorporation) technique under a pressurized-O2 atmosphere with the growth speed of 10 mm=h.
#Text=Feed rods for the floating-zone growth are prepared in the same manner as the polycrystalline sample.
#Text=The resultant crystal boule is 50 mm long and 7 mm in diameter and is transparent yellow brown in color [see the photo in Fig. 1(c)].
#Text=With x-ray (X’Pert3 Powder diffractometer, Panalytical) and Laue (Photonic Science) diffraction, we confirm that the single crystal is single phase over the whole length.
#Text=The crystal boule can be cleaved along the ab plane, and a cleaved crystal 2 × 2 × 0.5 mm3 in size is used for the magnetization measurement.
#Text=Specimens for transmission electron microscope (TEM) studies are prepared by mechanical polishing, followed by Ar ion milling.
#Text=Domain structures are studied using a TEM (JEOL-2010F) equipped with a 14-bit chargecoupled- device array detector.
#Text=Imaging plates are also used to record dark-field images.
#Text=All the Miller indices described in this paper are based on the P63=mmc parent phase.

#Text=Highangle annular dark-field (HAADF) scanning TEM (STEM) imaging and chemical mapping with an atomic-column resolution are carried out using a scanning TEM (JEOLARM200F) equipped with a spherical aberrationCs corrector in conjunction with energy-dispersive x-ray spectroscopy.
